I played against morde in top lane and any smart player will rekt the fuck out of you with a third hit Q. I crazy technique is to just hit two minions with it and then whack the champ on the third hit. it's predicable but it will hurt like hell and likewise solo W allows morde some heal drain that deals true damage so he is deceptively tough to fight against in top lane. I myself got a triple kill when I got jumped by a Yasuo(top) Rengar(jungler) and TF(mid) made all three of them my bitch. Likewise I was playing as Darius up top when morde raped the fuck out of me.  Morde is immobile but if he manages to get his Q off you are fucked.

The things is that Morde needs more power on his W and E while his Q's overall damage to be more evenly distributed among each hit. I mean at max rank his Q deals 1/13+3/13/ 9/13% per hit, the last being around 69% of the total damage which is a lot.

The thing is he's better in a duolane because if he farms the same amount, he has exactly the same strength as he would have in a sololane... while freeing one space for experience distribution. If you consider exp. as a ressource to distribute among players, which is kinda why I think the meta is what it is right now (divide exp. between top lane, mid lane, jungle and bot lane), bringing Morde to a sololane, knowing his passive is kind of a waste of that experience ressource.

This "whining" as you call it is not without reason. You would make post all the time about Yasuo if he was treated this way with a rework like Morde's or Cass'. Understand that Riot lied in saying they would help out these champions. They ruined their identity as a champion. Imagine if Riot decided to make a champion like{{champion:36}} a beefy fighter into a squishy mage don't you think that's unfair to the champions playerbase who play Mundo for who he is? A fighter that can literally go where he pleases because he can just eat damage and regen his hp fast is what makes Mundo's identity. Now imagine if Riot decided that he should just be a squishy mage that has to auto attack too do his damage and that he would be given no mobility of getting to his target and no real way of ccing them. You don't think that people have the right to call Riot out on their BS?

The attachement to old Morde really is astounding. He was either completely broken or garbage and there was no reason to pick him over any other champ whenever he wasn't broken. His kit provided no points of meaningful interaction for his opponent if the matchup was favorable to Morde and very few points of meaningful interaction for Morde if he was in an unfavorable matchup. His kit was the most underloaded piece of garbage in League and possessed 0 playmaking ability whatsoever, very problematic for a solo laner. 0 CC and 0 gap closers with enormous pushing power and innate survivability turned every lane into a non-stop shovefest that Morde typically won by default until the enemy jungler showed up to collect a free kill. 

You want Morde to keep his 0 CC  and 0 gap closer kit and still be viable but not broken? He has to go bot so that allies can do the playmaking for him. Solo lane Morde either had a good matchup and had no meaningful counterplay or had a bad matchup and did pretty much nothing. His balance of good and bad matchups was entirely determined by how strong Riot felt like letting him be at the time since Morde had 0 mechanical complexity to him. And lately, most of his matchups weren't great; Riot rightly realized how helpless it was to be against Morde when he was strong and kept him weak intentionally. Now that Morde is a bot laner, there's far more variables to tune on Mordekaiser and Riot actually has a chance of balancing him to a healthy place in the game, even if they're nowhere near that point yet.
